subject: AI & Agents
title: Neural Collaborative Filtering (NCF)
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Neural Collaborative Filtering (NCF).

hook.text: Matrix factorization uses dot products. Neural networks can learn richer interactions.

buildup.text: NCF replaces the dot product with a neural network that learns nonlinear user-item interactions.

discovery.text: Architecture: embed user and item, concatenate embeddings, pass through hidden layers, output score.

twist.text: NCF can capture complex patterns that linear factorization methods miss entirely.

climax.text: Trade-off: more expressive but harder to train, tune, and interpret than matrix factorization.

punchline.text: Replace linearity with neurons. Capture deeper patterns.

quiz.question: What advantage does NCF have over matrix factorization?
options: It captures nonlinear interactions between users and items
